Title: Brooklyn's Finest 
Original title: Brooklyn's Finest 
Country: USA 
USA release: 05/03/2010 
Released in Spain: 16/09/2011 
Studio: Millennium Films / Nu Image Films 
Director: Antoine Fuqua 
Screenplay: Michael C. Martin 
Starring: Richard Gere, Ethan Hawke, Don Cheadle, Jesse Williams, Ellen Barkin, Wesley Snipes, Lili Taylor, Brian F. O'Byrne, Shannon Kane, Will Patton, Vincent D'Onofrio 


Synopsis: 
A veteran cop named Eddie Dugan (Richard Gere) is in the last stage of his career, badly burned by years of service and a week away from retirement and start fishing retreat to a cabin in Connecticut. Furthermore, narcotics officer Sal Procida (Ethan Hawke) is clear that there is no line that does not cross to give his wife and seven children a stable and peaceful life. The third party in discord is Clarence "Tango" Butler (Don Cheadle), a cop who is always surrounded by men loyal and has a "special relationship" with Caz (Wesley Snipes), one of the most infamous drug dealers in Brooklyn that at this time is in prison. 

NYPD involved in the operation aimed at cleaning the streets of drugs, the three officers will be drawn by violence and corruption that plagues Brooklyn. For seven grueling days, Eddie, Sal and Tango will go inexorably toward the scene of the crime. The film captures the volatile and deadly world of one of the most dangerous districts of New York through the eyes of men and women who are committed to protecting and serving the streets.
